feed.title: Update on the Great Consensus Cleanup Revival

entry.title: Update on the Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
entry.summary: In a recent discussion on the Bitcoin Development Mailing List, Antoine Poinsot raised a question regarding a specific error condition, seeking clarification. The query was directed towards understanding the "SCRIPT_ERR_SIG_PUSHONLY" error condition in detail. This particular error is a point of interest within the context of Bitcoin's script execution and validation rules, highlighting the intricacies involved in transaction verification processes. The conversation signifies the ongoing efforts to deepen the understanding of Bitcoin's operational mechanics, particularly how transactions are validated and the types of errors that can occur during this process. For further details on this topic, Peter Todd's insights might be valuable and can be explored through [his website](https://petertodd.org). This exchange underscores the collaborative nature of the Bitcoin development community, where developers and enthusiasts alike come together to address and clarify technical aspects, ensuring a robust and secure cryptocurrency system.
